SENT.plain: Transient erythroblastopenia of childhood is a self-limited anemia occurring in previously healthy children, secondary to temporary cessation of erythrocyte production
Although the precise etiology is unclear, most cases are associated with a viral illness
The anemia may be severe, with associated pallor, tachypnea, and tachycardia; treatment is supportive
We present an unusual case of a child with viral-induced transient erythroblastopenia of childhood and associated ectopic atrial tachycardia, requiring therapy with antiarrhythmics
